PATIENT_ID: TEST_BLUNT_CHEST_001
ARRIVAL_TIME: 2026-01-22 08:00:00

[TRAUMA_HP] 2026-01-22 08:10:00
Category I trauma activation for 52-year-old male, MVC with steering wheel impact.
Blunt chest trauma with sternal tenderness and bilateral chest wall pain.
BP 100/65, HR 110, RR 26, GCS 15.
Breath sounds diminished on left. Respiratory distress noted.

[IMAGING] 2026-01-22 08:30:00
Portable AP chest x-ray: Left-sided pneumothorax. Multiple left rib fractures.
No widened mediastinum.
CT Chest: Left pneumothorax confirmed. Fractures of ribs 4-8 on left.
Small left hemothorax. Sternal contusion without fracture.

[NURSING_NOTE] 2026-01-22 08:45:00
Left chest tube placed. 200mL initial output.
Vital signs: BP 108/70, HR 102, RR 22. Hemodynamically stable post chest tube.

[PHYSICIAN_NOTE] 2026-01-22 09:00:00
Blunt thoracic injury with pneumothorax and hemothorax managed with chest tube.
EKG obtained: normal sinus rhythm, no ST changes. Cardiac contusion ruled out.
Respiratory status improving after chest tube placement.
